article_title: Falling Through the Cracks of China’s Health-Care System
article_text:
BEIJING—China says 95% of its 1.34 billion people are covered by medical insurance. That should have included Zhao Guomei, whose struggle with a rare but treatable disease shows how the system is failing for millions of China’s workers.

Doctors in July diagnosed Ms. Zhao with aplastic anemia, a bone marrow condition that put her at high risk of infection. They estimated her treatment would cost at least 400,000 to 500,000 yuan, or...

twitter.description: When 26-year-old Zhao Guomei was diagnosed with a rare illness, doctors estimated her treatment would cost up to $82,000. Like many young migrant workers in China, she didn’t have insurance, or the means to pay.
twitter.title: Falling Through the Cracks of China’s Health-Care System

image.alt: Millions of Chinese are falling through the cracks of the state’s fragmented health system
